alert.note: Alert for Jackson; Kanawha; Putnam; Roane (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 06 at 9:45AM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Kanawha, northeastern Putnam, western Roane and southeastern Jackson Counties through 1015 AM EDT... At 945 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Kenna, or 13 miles east of Winfield, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Minor water problems could be possible. Locations impacted include... Spencer, Winfield, Sissonville, Eleanor, Poca, Kenna, Teays Valley, Bancroft, Statts Mills, Harmony, Kentuck, Liberty, Walton, Looneyville, Gay and Gandeeville. This includes the following highways... Interstate 77 in West Virginia between mile markers 113 and 131. Interstate 64 in West Virginia between mile markers 42 and 44. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
